job_title: Supplemental Instructions (SI) Leader in Harrison, MI
pros: Work with people, help other students

review_title: An excellent place to gain experience, with supportive senior faculty and motivated students.
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Mount Pleasant, MI
pros: Senior faculty and administration give you a great deal of academic freedom to run your class the way you see fit.  Opportunities to create courses, small class size, excellent learning environment.  I would highly recommend this college to a peer.  Adjuncts are invited to all professional development activities, and senior faculty are very helpful in regards to career mentoring for junior and adjunct faculty.
cons: As a part time employee, it is easy to get lost in the shuffle, but this is common at any institution that relies on adjunct faculty.  The administration has recently implemented a new program to help adjuncts feel like a greater part of the learning community.

pros: The college is very good with allowing sick / vacation time. I have had a great experience at Mid which looks great on my resume'.
cons: Sometimes in my position it can get boring during slow times. But there are so many positions within the college that it really varies from person to person.

review_title: MMC offers great benefits in rural Michigan setting
job_title: Director, Business Training in Harrison, MI
pros: Focus on Skilled Trades, assisting area businesses in training current employees, programs that prepare students for local, state and national jobs, excellent benefits
cons: At times there is a contentious relationship between faculty and administration,   need for stronger orientation for adjunct faculty

pros: Mostly eager students, many of my students drove over an hour to come to class. Plenty of parking
cons: Students are far away, leads to some missed classes for them. Can make them fall behind and put you in a rough spot as a teacher.
